title: Kaley Cuoco is OK not living with husband Karl Cook: 'I have no problem with it'
text:
CLOSE Gwyneth Paltrow revealed why it took over a year for her husband Brad Falchuk to move in on ABC's "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" USA TODAY

They will be under the same roof "very soon," but for now Kaley Cuoco is totally cool with living separately from her husband of more than a year.

The "Big Bang Theory" alum, who wed equestrian Karl Cook on June 30, 2018, opened up about their unique arrangement to Extra over the weekend.

"We're building our dream house, so we’re gonna be in our home together very soon," Cuoco, 33, said. "But as of now, it’s worked out fine for us.

"I have no problem with it," she added.

The actress said of the couple spending time apart that "Life is about balance."

Cuoco spoke about her "very unconventional marriage" to E! News in August.

"We have different locations that we're at a lot."

Kaley Cuoco and Karl Cook have 'a very unconventional marriage,' don't live together yet

Gwyneth Paltrow explains why it took over a year for husband Brad Falchuk to move in

Kaley Cuoco and Karl Cook at a 2018 event in Culver City, Calif. (Photo: Casey Rodgers/Invision/AP)

And it's her ("Big Bang") theory that space helps their marriage stay strong.

"We're not together every single day, and I think personally it's important, it works well for us," she said. "If you want to Instagram shame each other, Instagram shame each other. It just makes life really fun."

Last week Gwyneth Paltrow confirmed to Jimmy Kimmel on his late night show that she and Brad Falchuk began living together about a year after exchanging vows in September 2018.

"The Politician" actress said they wanted to be considerate of their children before combining households. Paltrow has two children, Apple, 15, and Moses, 13, with ex-husband and Coldplay frontman Chris Martin. Falchuk has teens Isabella and Brody from his previous marriage.

"I think because we each have two teenage children, whom we love very much, we were just trying to be mindful and give them a little space and not move too quickly," she told Kimmel. "Now we're merged and it's great."

Contributing: Hannah Yasharoff

'Silicon Valley' star Thomas Middleditch reveals swinging 'saved' his marriage

description: They will be under the same roof "very soon," but for now Kaley Cuoco is cool living separately from her husband of more than a year, Karl Cook.
